fields.Title of Presentation: One Island Indivisible? Identifying Narratives of Literal and Literary Hispaniola
fields.Description/Abstract: From the Spanish and French imperial conquests, up to and after Haiti and the Dominican Republic’s respective wars of independence, Hispaniola has been conceived along geographical, racial, linguistic, economic and national lines.  This paper examines how literary works and recent events have challenged the traditional paradigms of identity at the heart of the island’s systemic divisions.
